subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Neo-Confucianism: The Revival
description: A quick win: understand Neo-Confucianism: The Revival.

hook.text: Buddhism invaded China's soul. Confucians fought back by absorbing Buddhist ideas. The result was a powerful remix.

buildup.text: By the Tang dynasty, Buddhism dominated Chinese thought. Confucian scholars felt threatened and responded creatively.

discovery.text: Zhu Xi (1130-1200) blended Confucian ethics with metaphysics, creating Neo-Confucianism. It became state ideology.

twist.text: Neo-Confucianism reached Korea and Japan, shaping samurai ethics and Korean social structure for centuries.

climax.text: Neo-Confucianism shows that traditions survive by evolving. The best response to challenge is creative adaptation.

punchline.text: Buddhism threatened Confucius. Confucians absorbed it and came back stronger.

quiz.question: What is Neo-Confucianism?
options: A revival that blended Confucian ethics with Buddhist metaphysics
